header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 131, Volume XIX-6 (December 1993)
header.category: Western Esotericism, Modern Occultism, Setian Philosophy

central_thesis: The Scroll of Set, December 1993 issue, articulates a comprehensive framework for Setian self-deification, emphasizing Xeper (self-evolution) and Remanifestation (active manifestation) as central processes. It redefines magic as a sophisticated communication system with the universe, highlights the "sense of wonder" as a crucial operative tool for initiating transformative change, and re-evaluates core philosophical concepts such as 'balance' and 'time' within an evolving organizational structure of specialized Pylons dedicated to advanced occult exploration.

structure_content.summary: Discusses the challenges of publishing a controversial book on the Left-Hand Path and offers early manuscript copies, noting their 'initiatorily beneficial' content for Setians.

Recommends and reviews academic texts on critical thinking, advocating for their application in self-evaluation and in discerning external information, thereby refining a magician's personal practice.

structure_content.chapter_title: [6] Xem Pylon Proposal / [7] Xem: A Creation
structure_content.summary: Proposes the establishment of a specialized Pylon for the systematic exploration of Xem, an 'Æon-enhancing Word' vital for refining Xeper and transforming the self, acknowledging the challenges of advancing it without its original Magus.

structure_content.chapter_title: [8] Time to Live, No Time to Die / [9] Limited Infinity?
structure_content.summary: Explores philosophical perspectives on the subjective nature of time and memory, proposing that the 'self' undergoes an evolutionary journey through various physical incarnations to achieve higher states of Xeper, beyond linear time constraints.
Outlines a practical exercise for sensory re-tuning, designed to induce altered states of consciousness by associating colors with non-visual sensory input, thereby challenging ordinary perception.

Presents a semiotic theory of magic, framing it as a communication system between man and the universe. It explains how magicians utilize fiction writing to send symbolic messages into the 'semiosphere' and why reading occult fiction facilitates receiving communication from the 'other side'.

Elaborates on the 'sense of wonder' as a fundamental tool for the Black Magician, defining it as a loosening of 'reality' to perceive the 'real.' It acts as a gateway between subjective and objective realms, and a method for grasping initiatory truths, including a 'time-travel magic' ritual.

structure_content.chapter_title: [24] The Will Pertaining to Xeper and Remanifest
structure_content.summary: Provides in-depth definitions of Xeper as a state of conscious self-power, freedom, and mastery, and Remanifestation as the active process of developing one's will into a dominant emotional force, both essential for Setian becoming.
Challenges the conventional understanding of 'balance' as stasis, arguing that Setian Xeper necessitates 'imbalance' and continuous change, reflecting the original cosmic act of Set.

key_concepts.definition: The core Setian process of self-evolution and becoming; a state of conscious self-power, self-action, freedom of expression, and self-mastery, characterized by the recognition of one's own existence and power and active self-transformation.

The active manifestation and development of one's will, leading to it becoming a dominant emotional and spiritual force; a continuous process of bringing new impulses to the world, experienced as courage and daring.
An 'Æon-enhancing Word' and 'eternal goal' within the Temple of Set, focused on refining individual Xeper and transforming self-qualities. Its exploration is facilitated through dedicated Pylons.

A crucial experience for the Black Magician, defined as the loosening of the 'webwork of reality' to perceive the 'real.' It serves as a gateway between subjective and objective universes, a method for communicating magical work, and a means to grasp initiatory truths beyond rational understanding.

The art or science of causing changes in the subjective universe, which result in proportionate changes in the objective universe. It involves active, willed volition to communicate with and receive responses from the 'hidden side' of the universe.

A reinterpretation within Setian philosophy. Conventional 'balance' is equated with stasis and inactivity, which is contrary to Xeper. True Setian striving and progress (Xeper) are achieved through 'imbalance' and continuous change, mirroring Set's original act of moving the cosmic order from balance to imbalance.
Specific terms or concepts (e.g., Xem, Runa, Remanifestation) that serve as differentiations of the Æonic Formula, providing distinct paths or tools to focus or accelerate the process of Xeper.

A conceptualization of magic as a communication system where the magician sends messages (cultural coded symbols) to the 'hidden 'other side' of the universe' with the conscious intent to receive a response (revelation or environmental change).

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is one of continuous individual self-evolution (Xeper) and active manifestation (Remanifestation), meticulously driven by a consciously cultivated 'sense of wonder.' It frames magic as a communication system where the magician projects specific intent through cultural coded symbols and receives feedback from the hidden realm. Fundamental to this practice is rigorous critical thinking and self-observation, used to analyze experiences, refine personal values, and make deliberate choices that advance one's Xeper. Specialized Pylons are established to provide structured environments for both individual and collective exploration of specific Æon-enhancing Words.
tools: **Critical Thinking:** A systematic approach to evaluating information, beliefs, and one's own thought processes using specific questions (e.g., identifying issues, reasons, ambiguities, assumptions, flaws in reasoning) to counteract cognitive biases and refine understanding, especially in magical context.

**Self-Observation & Introspection:** Constant monitoring of one's internal states, motivations, and the effects of magical work, coupled with a rigorous analysis of personal values to ensure alignment with the goals of Xeper and Remanifestation.

**Conscious Intent & Will:** The disciplined application of one's will to create desired changes, moving beyond passive desire to active, purposeful manifestation. This involves initiating tasks, persisting as required, and discontinuing when wisdom dictates.

**Symbolic Communication (Writing & Art):** Utilizing creative expression, such as writing fiction, poetry, or creating art, as a medium to 'send messages into the semiosphere' (the hidden realm) and to receive 'revelations' or 'communication from the other side,' thereby actively working magic.

**Pylon Structures:** Organizational groups within the Temple of Set that provide a structured environment for focused, collective, or individual exploration of specific esoteric concepts ('Æon-enhancing Words') like Xem, facilitating their advancement and application to Xeper.
rituals: **Art of Hearing Color Exercise:** A sensory re-tuning technique to induce altered states of consciousness. It involves anointing oneself, using earplugs, closing eyes, and chanting a verse that associates colors with non-visual sensory inputs (e.g., 'Black is thunder! Blue is waves! Red is the blood coursing through my veins! Yellow is a stone rolling down a hill! Green is the sound of a grinding mill!'). The goal is to break ordinary perception and record results upon slowly re-engaging the senses.

**Time-Travel Magic (Sense of Wonder Ritual):** An operative ritual utilizing the sense of wonder for 'mental and physical rejuvenation.' The practitioner recalls a past moment that evoked a tremendous sense of wonder, identifies all contributing factors (sensory, emotional, environmental), and then physically re-enacts that precise event alone. This act, done with the conscious intent of experiencing awe, aims to associate one's essence with the 'realm of the real' and cultivate a 'youthful nature,' leading to continuous new impulses in the world.

relevant_quotes.text: As many of you know, last year I finished a manuscript for a book entitled Lords of the Left-Hand Path. Over the past year I have been negotiating for the publication of the book with a major publisher. These negotiations have proven difficult - in part due to the 'controversial' and 'taboo' character of the contents of the book. As these negotiations are still continuing, it now seems inconceivable that this book could be on the shelves of bookstores before another two years have past.

To become an active filter of what you read and hear [rather than a passive sponge who believes what the last person told them], Browne and Keeley suggest you ask the following questions about texts: [...]

Xem is a source of unending fascination to Setians. [...] I would say the former is correct. Xem was and is an eternal goal, a striving and utilization of the powers of Coming Into Being. The academics of it are fascinating, but at the center of it all is a valid and V° concept applicable to all facets of Initiation, that being one of the hallmarks of a Word. It is active even though its Magus is no longer with us.

The formula takes its origin from the discourse between man and his universe, in the case of a particular formula a discourse concerning a certain object and the fulfillment of a desire. In this discourse man feels addressed or singled out by his universe, and he endeavors to address it in turn, trying to discover the kind of address to which his universe will be willing to answer, that is, willing to show itself communicable.
The sense of wonder comes when the webwork of 'reality' is loosed and we can see the real.
The sense of wonder is the gateway (or magical link) between the subjective and objective universes. As magicians we have come to realize that magic does not overcome the natural order.

There is a state of consciousness which may be called Xeper, a state in which the will becomes conscious of its own existence, its powers, and its possibilities. It is a fact thoroughly attested by the actual experience of many individuals.
So to Xeper one must not be balanced, but imbalanced.

critical_analysis.relevance: This Scroll of Set issue is highly relevant for understanding the philosophical and practical evolution of Setianism in the early 1990s. It details internal discussions on core concepts like Xeper and Remanifestation, the establishment of new Pylons for focused magical work, and the unique Setian perspective on magic as a communication system and the cultivation of 'wonder.' It also reflects the Temple's engagement with broader occult and critical thought, offering significant refinements to core Setian tenets, particularly regarding the dynamic nature of becoming over static equilibrium.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily Setian Initiates (II° and above) engaged in advanced self-evolution and magical practice. It also serves practitioners of the Left-Hand Path interested in theoretical occultism, the semiotics of magic, and practical exercises for consciousness alteration. The included book recommendations broaden its appeal to those interested in critical thinking and the historical/cultural aspects of occult literature.
